Comments_List: Understanding of international monetary system. Able to answer questions like why US bonds enjoy such a low interests.
An understand of current research relating to international monetary systems

Strength: Well structured, deep content, engaging lectures 
Weakness: only meet once a week
I enjoy that it was open ended and allowed us to write and present our own paper instead of a final.
giving out deadlines on the syllabus at the beginning of the semester would be helpful, but not necessary
Absolutely. This is one of the few econ courses I have taken at Yale that focuses almost exclusively on the cutting edge of research in the field, making it truly engaging and fascinating
Yes. I would recommend the class to another student who is interested in understanding global monetary system.
it was really technical, so without a strong background in international trade/statistics I oftentimes was a bit lost
